evals.prompt: If I increase the enclosure depth by 15mm (205 to 220mm) and keep everything else the same, what happens to the port tuning and volume?
evals.expected_output: Agent should calculate: volume increase of ~15 × 0.033 = ~0.5L, new net volume ~6.18L, port tuning shift from ~55Hz down to ~52Hz using f_new = f_old × sqrt(V_old/V_new). Should mention this moves further from Carmody's target and suggest height reduction to compensate.

assertions.name: suggests_compensation
assertions.description: Suggests height reduction or other compensation

evals.prompt: What's the baffle step frequency and how does our roundover help with diffraction?
evals.expected_output: Agent should compute: baffle step at 344000/(π×180) ≈ 608 Hz, roundover effective above 344000/(2π×20) ≈ 2737 Hz. Should explain the relationship between baffle step and roundover, note the crossover frequency is typically 3-4kHz, and compare to the original MDF box which had no roundover.

assertions.name: contextualizes
assertions.description: Relates to crossover frequency and original design
